display_asset.caption: A satellite image of Mischief Reef taken on Sept. 8.
display_asset.credit: Center for Strategic and International Studies, via Reuters

summaries.body: New satellite images show that China has started construction of an airstrip on a third artificial island in the contested waters of the South China Sea.
The brother of Jason Rezaian, a Washington Post journalist imprisoned in Iran for more than a year, appealed to a U.N. human rights panel to intercede with the Iranian authorities.
Two French illustrators have been denounced for publishing editorial cartoons inspired by harrowing photographs of Aylan Kurdi, the Syrian boy who drowned off Greece.
Facebook’s famous “like” button will soon be accompanied by an alternative: a way to “dislike” a post, said Mark Zuckerberg, the chief executive of the social networking giant.
At least two students died after a Houston school bus careened from a highway overpass on Tuesday morning.

posts.footer: Reuters via The New York Times

display_asset.caption: German luxury carmaker BMW’s new chief executive, Harald Krueger, fainted on stage at the Frankfurt auto show.
display_asset.sub_title: BMW CEO faints on stage at Frankfurt auto show
display_asset.title: BMW Executive Faints at Frankfurt Auto Show

summaries.body: BMW's new chief executive, Harald Krueger, fainted on stage at the closely watched Frankfurt auto show. The company said his health is stable and he is recovering.

display_asset.caption: An Israeli soldier near the Al Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem on Tuesday during a third day of clashes with Palestinian protesters at the contested site.

summaries.body: Palestinian youths and the Israeli police clashed for a third day at Al Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem, prompting a rare warning to Israel from King Abdullah II of Jordan.

Jeremy Corbyn, the socialist who won an upset victory to head Britain's Labour Party, is facing broad criticism. An earlier version of this post said Mr. Corbyn had asked for "at least a week" in the job to prove himself, but it was a union supporter who suggested Mr. Corbyn be given time.
At least eight people have died in flash floods in Utah along the Arizona border. Five people are still missing.
The inflation rate in Britain fell to zero in August, driven down by lower cost for fuel and clothing. A measure of core price pressures also eased.
A Kuwaiti court sentenced seven people to death for a suicide bombing at a Shiite mosque in June that killed 27 people, the state news agency reported.

display_asset.credit: Wissam Nassar for The New York Times

summaries.body: Several hundred Palestinians demonstrated in central Gaza over increasing power cuts, the latest in a series of protests that appear to have erupted over the issue.
A court ruled that copyright holders must consider fair use before asking YouTube to remove content in a lawsuit over a video of a toddler dancing to a Prince song.

display_asset.caption: Gary Richrath playing with REO Speedwagon in 1980.
display_asset.credit: Larry Hulst/Michael Ochs Archives, via Getty Images

summaries.body: Gary Richrath, the longtime lead guitarist for the rock band REO Speedwagon, has died. He was 65.
Vanity Fair's new cover, featuring 10 late-night-television hosts, became a hot topic of discussion on social media, because none of them were women.

display_asset.caption: Saada, in northern Yemen, a stronghold of the Houthi rebels, has come under intense bombardment by the Saudi-led coalition.

summaries.body: The United Nations' human rights chief has called for inquiries into actions against civilians by both the Saudi-led coalition and the Houthi rebels it is fighting.
The Navy has agreed to limit its use of sonar and some training tools, including explosives, that harm whales, dolphins and other marine life off Hawaii and California.
A judge denied bail for Michael Slager, the former North Charleston, S.C., police officer charged with murder in the April shooting death of a black motorist, Walter Scott.
Spencer Stone, injured while thwarting a gunman on a French train with two other Americans, will receive the Purple Heart and the Air Force Airman's Medal.
A professor was fatally shot at Delta State University in Cleveland, Miss., and the police were searching for another professor in connection with the shooting.

display_asset.caption: Joseph Thomas Johnson-Shanks was fatally shot after he refused to drop his weapon and then aimed it in troopers’ direction, the state police said.
display_asset.credit: Kentucky State Police, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Police officers in Kentucky shot and killed a man, identified as Joseph Thomas Johnson-Shanks, right, suspected of killing a state trooper during a traffic stop the day before.

display_asset.caption: Joyce E. Mitchell in court in July. She faces up to seven years in prison and is to be sentenced on Sept. 28.

summaries.body: Joyce Mitchell, the New York prison worker who helped two convicted murderers escape, said in an interview with Matt Lauer that she was driven by depression and fear.
A Ukrainian firm and its chief executive agreed to pay $30 million to settle S.E.C. charges that they illegally profited from information stolen from newswire services.
NBC said it has cast Arnold Schwarzenegger to take over the hosting duties of Donald Trump in its next season of "The Celebrity Apprentice."

display_asset.caption: The Yosemite Valley in July. The gradual melting of snow in California's mountains usually fills the state's reservoirs with water, but researchers said this past year's snowpack was unusually low.

summaries.body: California’s Sierra Nevada had its lowest snowpack in 500 years, according to a new report that suggests droughts in the state may become more common.
Our reporters are filing dispatches from the Toronto Film Festival on the sleepers, crowd-pleasers and Oscar-hopefuls. And Matt Damon answered readers' questions.
Betty Cantrell of Georgia was crowned Miss America on Sunday night. But her victory was eclipsed by the pageant's apology to Vanessa Williams, who was forced to resign the title in 1984.
An American Airlines spokesman said that the carrier had accidentally sent the wrong plane to Hawaii from Los Angeles. The plane was not equipped for a long-haul flight.
A new class-action lawsuit says that New York City has a policy and a history of violating protesters’ constitutional rights.
The United States, which spent more than $4 billion in assistance to El Salvador’s military during its civil war, is now working to bring some of the officers to justice.
